product_overview: DevBrows Portfolio Site is a personal portfolio web application built using modern technologies like Next.js 15 with a focus on modularity, theme customization, and reusable UI components. It serves as a professional landing platform showcasing about, services, work portfolio, and contact information with a sleek, black and purple themed interface.
core_goals: Provide a responsive and visually appealing personal portfolio website.
Enable dark/light theme toggling with a custom black and purple color palette.
Showcase personal information, services offered, and portfolio work in clear, well-structured sections.
Implement a reusable UI component library ensuring consistent design and interactions.
Facilitate seamless external linking for social media and portfolio contact methods.
Optimize the user experience with animated reveals, custom cursors, and accessible UI patterns.
Maintain a scalable and maintainable codebase using TypeScript, React, and Next.js App Router.
key_features: Global theming with dark/light mode support and a custom black and purple color scheme.
Landing page structured into sections: About, Services, Work, Contact, plus footer and interactive overlays (grain effect, magnetic button, custom cursor).
Reusable UI component library built on Radix UI and Tailwind CSS, including buttons, dialogs, forms, navigation, feedback components, carousel, calendar, and more.
Custom React hooks for device detection, scroll/visibility reveal animations, and toast notifications.
Utility functions for class merging and other helpers.
Fixed footer with DevBrows attribution linked externally.
Hardcoded social media URLs with proper external linking behaviours.
Next.js 15 App Router layout with font and global style setup.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the home page and views the hero section followed by about, services, and work sections.
User scrolls through content with smooth reveal animations enhancing engagement.
User interacts with buttons, forms, and dialogs built from the UI component library.
User clicks social media icons in the contact section that open external links in new tabs.
User toggles theme between dark and light modes, observing a black and purple color theme.
User accesses footer with DevBrows link for attribution and possibly navigates externally.
validation_criteria: The site loads without npm installation errors after upgrading dependencies like vaul.
Theme toggle works correctly applying the black and purple palette consistently across all components.
All sections (about, services, work, contact) render properly and are navigable via scrolling.
Social media icons in contact section have correct hardcoded URLs and open in new tabs.
UI components function visually and interactively as expected according to Radix UI patterns.
Custom hooks trigger expected behaviors: device detection, animation reveal, toast notifications.
Footer is fixed, full-width, contains the DevBrows link, and the link opens externally.
Automated tests via Testsprite run successfully against the live development server.
